description: From Middle English regioun, from Anglo-Norman regiun, from Latin regiō, from regō.

entries.meaning: Any considerable and connected part of a space or surface; specifically, a tract of land or sea of considerable but indefinite extent; a country; a district; in a broad sense, a place without special reference to location or extent but viewed as an entity for geographical, social or cultural reasons.
examples: the upper regions of the atmosphere

definitionGroups.group: An administrative subdivision of a city, a territory, a country.

entries.meaning: (historical) Such a division of the city of Rome and of the territory about Rome, of which the number varied at different times; a district, quarter, or ward.
An administrative subdivision of the European Union.
A subnational region of Chile; equivalent to province.
(Ontario) Ellipsis of regional municipality; a county-level municipality.
A subprovincial region of Quebec; the primary level subdivision; a prefecture.
(figuratively) The inhabitants of a region or district of a country.
(anatomy) A place in or a part of the body in any way indicated.
(obsolete) The space from the earth's surface out to the orbit of the moon: properly called the elemental region.
